nodes.bodyText: not for this PR - but in general - we probably need a reliable way to get a free node port
comment does not seem to match code
again uniqueness will be an issue
exists
exist
ready or running?
we need to make sure the diagnostics are collected - i think it should be left to the extension to delete the namespaces
include namespace in the message please
include namespace in the message please
seems awkward
Anil mentioned that he sets "0" to adminNodePort and it picks the available port. @markxnelson Is it good idea to do that? It may not be in the node port range.
use logger
make the method private or add javadoc

This doesn't work for Jenkins runs. You have to move the code which gets the "REPO" env var into the repo* variables before calling this. Otherwise this will create secret with dummy values which won't work on Jenkins.
The @AfterEach annotation is removed from tearDown() method, and the method is only called in this class. Change it to private.
it seems that this is a private method.
Shall we indicate in the test name that the second domain is in the same namespace as the first domain?

Sankar has added injection of the namespaces in the initAll() method so that the diagnostic code can collect data of all namespaces that are used in the test. Once you sync with the latest develop branch, you can just increase the number of namespaces in the initAll() method; no need to create one yourself.
